1127477215472562176.text: Sure, the sun is causing our warming earth over recent decades, but not because the sun is getting hotter. We're helping.https://twitter.com/NASAClimate/status/1126532737165172736¬†‚Ä¶

1127548151248891904.text: How did we come out of the mini ice age without car exhaust and cow farts. The world may never know...

1127610543546744833.text: Your question seems sarcastic, but science has lots of good facts and ideas you can learn about. The last 5 million years have been more cold than not. This CO2 graph is from air bubbles in glacial ice back 800k, and closely track temperature.pic.twitter.com/IrVS61P86j

1127675277054763016.text: There's a large school of thought also going back for millennia that focuses on solar cycles, having nothing to do with mankind on Earth.

1127678093299154946.text:
"Large school of thought" is a weaselly assertion. The 100,000 year glacial cycles we are in are known to be due to the Milankovitch cycles, not solar variations but perturbations in the shape of our orbit and inclination of the earth's axis of the seasons
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milankovitch_cycles¬†‚Ä¶

1127700219607552000.text: "weaselly assertion" from someone opposed to a competing school if thought. Great science there. I f the global warming cabal was so confident in their assertions why did they have to fudge their numbers? It made a laughing stock of the entire community. Not buying it.

1127704048772186112.text: Tell me more about your competing school of thought. Judith Curry might be a member. She doesn't claim scientists have fudged their numbers, but calls it a "wicked problem" of feedback loops so that predicting future warming is not certain.https://judithcurry.com¬†

1127694591115911170.text: Volcanic eruptions are known to cause global cooling by adding ash to the atmosphere, and surely large meteorite impacts could do similarly. But neither can explain warming over the last 50 years.

1127724985638948864.text: What we are seeing now was predicted 30 years ago. I was part of the field at that time and the only thing surprising now is that things are moving faster than most expected*. This is now settled science, and people just need to get used to that.

1127786038888415232.text: If not the averages, the standard deviation has/is getting deeper. Snowy below zero winter is almost gone. One of the benefits of living in one place for 30 years?

1127788542913126400.text: Yes, the winters where I live are noticeably warmer too.
